37.verse: When God led Israel from Egypt, they took silver and gold, and no one was left behind.

38.verse: The Egyptians were afraid and gladly let them go.

39.verse: God hid them under a cloud and guided them by fire during the night.

40.verse: When they asked for food, he sent more birds than they could eat.

41.verse: God even split open a rock, and streams of water gushed into the desert.

42.verse: God never forgot his sacred promise to his servant Abraham.

43.verse: When the Lord rescued his chosen people from Egypt, they celebrated with songs.

44.verse: The Lord gave them the land and everything else the nations had worked for.

45.verse: He did this so that his people would obey all of his laws. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: A Nation Asks for Forgiveness - We will celebrate and praise you, LORD! You are good to us, and your love never fails.

2.verse: No one can praise you enough for all of the mighty things you have done.

3.verse: You bless those people who are honest and fair in everything they do.

4.verse: Remember me, LORD, when you show kindness by saving your people.

5.verse: Let me prosper with the rest of your chosen ones, as they celebrate with pride because they belong to you.

6.verse: We and our ancestors have sinned terribly.

7.verse: When they were in Egypt, they paid no attention to your marvelous deeds or your wonderful love. And they turned against you at the Red Sea.

8.verse: But you were true to your name, and you rescued them to prove how mighty you are.

9.verse: You said to the Red Sea, “Dry up!” Then you led your people across on land as dry as a desert.

10.verse: You saved all of them

11.verse: and drowned every one of their enemies.

12.verse: Then your people trusted you and sang your praises.

13.verse: But they soon forgot what you had done and rejected your advice.

14.verse: They became greedy for food and tested you there in the desert.

15.verse: So you gave them what they wanted, but later you destroyed them with a horrible disease.

16.verse: Everyone in camp was jealous of Moses and of Aaron, your chosen priest.

17.verse: Dathan and Abiram rebelled, and the earth opened up and swallowed them.

18.verse: Then fire broke out and destroyed all of their followers.

19.verse: At Horeb your people made and worshiped the statue

20.verse: of a bull, instead of you, their glorious God.

21.verse: You worked powerful miracles to save them from Egypt, but they forgot about you

22.verse: and the fearsome things you did at the Red Sea.

23.verse: You were angry and started to destroy them, but Moses, your chosen leader, begged you not to do it.

24.verse: They would not trust you, LORD, and they did not like the promised land.

25.verse: They would not obey you, and they grumbled in their tents.

26.verse: So you threatened them by saying, “I’ll kill you out here in the desert!

27.verse: I’ll scatter your children everywhere in the world.”

28.verse: Your people became followers of a god named Baal Peor, and they ate sacrifices offered to the dead.

29.verse: They did such terrible things that you punished them with a deadly disease.

30.verse: But Phinehas helped them, and the sickness stopped.

31.verse: Now he will always be highly honored.

32.verse: At Meribah Spring they turned against you and made you furious.

33.verse: Then Moses got into trouble for speaking in anger.

34.verse: Our LORD, they disobeyed you by refusing to destroy the nations.

35.verse: Instead they were friendly with those foreigners and followed their customs.

36.verse: Then they fell into the trap of worshiping idols.

37.verse: They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons

38.verse: and to the gods of Canaan. Then they poured out the blood of these innocent children and made the land filthy.

39.verse: By doing such gruesome things, they also became filthy.

40.verse: Finally, LORD, you were angry and terribly disgusted with your people.

41.verse: So you put them in the power of nations that hated them.

42.verse: They were mistreated and abused by their enemies,

43.verse: but you saved them time after time. They were determined to rebel, and their sins caused their downfall.

44.verse: You answered their prayers when they were in trouble.

45.verse: You kept your agreement and were so merciful

46.verse: that their enemies had pity on them.

47.verse: Save us, LORD God! Bring us back from among the nations. Let us celebrate and shout in praise of your holy name.

48.verse: LORD God of Israel, you deserve to be praised forever and ever. Let everyone say, “Amen! Shout praises to the LORD!”

1.verse: BOOK V (Psalms 107-150) The LORD Is Good to His People - Shout praises to the LORD! He is good to us, and his love never fails.

2.verse: Everyone the LORD has rescued from trouble should praise him,

3.verse: everyone he has brought from the east and the west, the north and the south.

4.verse: Some of you were lost in the scorching desert, far from a town.

5.verse: You were hungry and thirsty and about to give up.

6.verse: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.

7.verse: Right away he brought you to a town.

8.verse: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.

9.verse: To everyone who is thirsty, he gives something to drink; to everyone who is hungry, he gives good things to eat.

10.verse: Some of you were prisoners suffering in deepest darkness and bound by chains,

11.verse: because you had rebelled against God Most High and refused his advice.

12.verse: You were worn out from working like slaves, and no one came to help.

13.verse: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.

14.verse: He brought you out of the deepest darkness and broke your chains.

15.verse: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.

16.verse: He breaks down bronze gates and shatters iron locks.

17.verse: Some of you had foolishly committed a lot of sins and were in terrible pain.

18.verse: The very thought of food was disgusting to you, and you were almost dead.

19.verse: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.

20.verse: By the power of his own word, he healed you and saved you from destruction.

21.verse: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.

22.verse: You should celebrate by offering sacrifices and singing joyful songs to tell what he has done.

23.verse: Some of you made a living by sailing the mighty sea,

24.verse: and you saw the miracles the LORD performed there.

25.verse: At his command a storm arose, and waves covered the sea.

26.verse: You were tossed to the sky and to the ocean depths, until things looked so bad that you lost your courage.

27.verse: You staggered like drunkards and gave up all hope.

28.verse: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.

29.verse: He made the storm stop and the sea be quiet.

30.verse: You were happy because of this, and he brought you to the port where you wanted to go.

31.verse: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.

32.verse: Honor the LORD when you and your leaders meet to worship.

33.verse: If you start doing wrong, the LORD will turn rivers into deserts,

34.verse: flowing streams into scorched land, and fruitful fields into beds of salt.

35.verse: But the LORD can also turn deserts into lakes and scorched land into flowing streams.

36.verse: If you are hungry, you can settle there and build a town.

37.verse: You can plant fields and vineyards that produce a good harvest.

38.verse: The LORD will bless you with many children and with herds of cattle.

39.verse: Sometimes you may be crushed by troubles and sorrows, until only a few of you are left to survive.

40.verse: But the LORD will take revenge on those who conquer you, and he will make them wander across desert sands.

41.verse: When you are suffering and in need, he will come to your rescue, and your families will grow as fast as a herd of sheep.

42.verse: You will see this because you obey the LORD, but everyone who is wicked will be silenced.

43.verse: Be wise! Remember this and think about the kindness of the LORD.

1.verse: (A song and a psalm by David.)With God on Our Side - Our God, I am faithful to you with all my heart, and you can trust me. I will sing and play music for you with all that I am.

2.verse: I will start playing my harps before the sun rises.

3.verse: I will praise you, LORD, for everyone to hear; I will sing hymns to you in every nation.

4.verse: Your love reaches higher than the heavens, and your loyalty extends beyond the clouds.

5.verse: Our God, may you be honored above the heavens; may your glory be seen everywhere on earth.

6.verse: Answer my prayers and use your powerful arm to give us victory. Then the people you love will be safe.

7.verse: Our God, from your holy place you made this promise: “I will gladly divide up the city of Shechem and give away Succoth Valley piece by piece.

8.verse: The lands of Gilead and Manasseh are mine. Ephraim is my war helmet, and Judah is my symbol of royal power.

9.verse: Moab is merely my washbasin, and Edom belongs to me. I shout with victory over the Philistines.”

10.verse: Our God, who will bring me to the fortress or lead me to Edom?

11.verse: Have you rejected us? You don’t lead our armies.

12.verse: Help us defeat our enemies! No one else can rescue us.

13.verse: You are the one who gives us victory and crushes our enemies.

1.verse: (A psalm by David for the music leader.)A Prayer for the LORD’s Help - I praise you, God! Don’t keep silent.

2.verse: Destructive and deceitful lies are told about me,

3.verse: and hateful things are said for no reason.

4.verse: I had pity and prayed for my enemies, but their words to me were harsh and cruel.

5.verse: For being friendly and kind, they paid me back with meanness and hatred.

6.verse: My enemies said, “Find some worthless fools to accuse him of a crime.

7.verse: Try him and find him guilty! Consider his prayers a lie.

8.verse: Cut his life short and let someone else have his job.

9.verse: Make orphans of his children and a widow of his wife;

10.verse: make his children beg for food and live in the slums.

11.verse: “Let the people he owes take everything he owns. Give it all to strangers.

12.verse: Don’t let anyone be kind to him or have pity on the children he leaves behind.

13.verse: Bring an end to his family, and from now on let him be a forgotten man.

14.verse: “Don’t let the LORD forgive the sins of his parents and his ancestors.

15.verse: Don’t let the LORD forget the sins of his family, or let anyone remember his family ever lived.

16.verse: He was so cruel to the poor, homeless, and discouraged that they died young.

17.verse: “He cursed others. Now place a curse on him! He never wished others well. Wish only trouble for him!

18.verse: He cursed others more often than he dressed himself. Let his curses strike him deep, just as water and olive oil soak through to our bones.

19.verse: Let his curses surround him, just like the clothes he wears each day.”

20.verse: Those are the cruel things my enemies wish for me. Let it all happen to them!

21.verse: Be true to your name, LORD God! Show your great kindness and rescue me.

22.verse: I am poor and helpless, and I have lost all hope.

23.verse: I am fading away like an evening shadow; I am tossed aside like a crawling insect.

24.verse: I have gone without eating, until my knees are weak, and my body is bony.

25.verse: When my enemies see me, they say cruel things and shake their heads.

26.verse: Please help me, LORD God! Come and save me because of your love.

27.verse: Let others know that you alone have saved me.

28.verse: I don’t care if they curse me, as long as you bless me. You will make my enemies fail when they attack, and you will make me glad to be your servant.

29.verse: You will cover them with shame, just as their bodies are covered with clothes.

30.verse: I will sing your praises and thank you, LORD, when your people meet.

31.verse: You help everyone in need, and you defend them when they are on trial.

1.verse: (A psalm by David.)The LORD Gives Victory - The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at my right side, until I make your enemies into a footstool for you.”

2.verse: The LORD will let your power reach out from Zion, and you will rule over your enemies.

3.verse: Your glorious power will be seen on the day you begin to rule. You will wear the sacred robes and shine like the morning sun in all of your strength.

4.verse: The LORD has made a promise that will never be broken: “You will be a priest forever, just like Melchizedek.”

5.verse: My Lord is at your right side, and when he gets angry he will crush the other kings.

6.verse: He will judge the nations and crack their skulls, leaving piles of dead bodies all over the earth.

7.verse: He will drink from any stream that he chooses, while winning victory after victory.

1.verse: Praise the LORD for All He Has Done - Shout praises to the LORD! With all my heart I will thank the LORD when his people meet.

2.verse: The LORD has done many wonderful things! Everyone who is pleased with God’s marvelous deeds will keep them in mind.

3.verse: Everything the LORD does is glorious and majestic, and his power to bring justice will never end.

4.verse: The LORD God is famous for his wonderful deeds, and he is kind and merciful.

5.verse: He gives food to his worshipers and always keeps his agreement with them.

6.verse: He has shown his mighty power to his people and has given them the lands of other nations.

7.verse: God is always honest and fair, and his laws can be trusted.

8.verse: They are true and right and will stand forever.

9.verse: God rescued his people, and he will never break his agreement with them. He is fearsome and holy.

10.verse: Respect and obey the LORD! This is the first step to wisdom and good sense. God will always be respected.

1.verse: God Blesses His Worshipers - Shout praises to the LORD! The LORD blesses everyone who worships him and gladly obeys his teachings.

2.verse: Their descendants will have great power in the land, because the LORD blesses all who do right.

3.verse: They will get rich and prosper and will always be remembered for their fairness.

4.verse: They will be so kind and merciful and good, that they will be a light in the dark for others who do the right thing.

5.verse: Life will go well for those who freely lend and are honest in business.

6.verse: They won’t ever be troubled, and the kind things they do will never be forgotten.

7.verse: Bad news won’t bother them; they have decided to trust the LORD.

8.verse: They are dependable and not afraid, and they will live to see their enemies defeated.

9.verse: They will always be remembered and greatly praised, because they were kind and freely gave to the poor.

10.verse: When evil people see this, they angrily bite their tongues and disappear. They will never get what they really want.

1.verse: The LORD Helps People in Need - Shout praises to the LORD! Everyone who serves him, come and praise his name.

2.verse: Let the name of the LORD be praised now and forever.

3.verse: From dawn until sunset the name of the LORD deserves to be praised.

4.verse: The LORD is far above all of the nations; he is more glorious than the heavens.

5.verse: No one can compare with the LORD our God. His throne is high above,

6.verse: and he looks down to see the heavens and the earth.

7.verse: God lifts the poor and needy from dust and ashes,

8.verse: and he lets them take part in ruling his people.

9.verse: When a wife has no children, he blesses her with some, and she is happy. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: The LORD Works Wonders - God brought his people out of Egypt, that land with a strange language.

2.verse: He made Judah his holy place and ruled over Israel.

3.verse: When the sea looked at God, it ran away, and the Jordan River flowed upstream.

4.verse: The mountains and the hills skipped around like goats.

5.verse: Ask the sea why it ran away or ask the Jordan why it flowed upstream.

6.verse: Ask the mountains and the hills why they skipped like goats!

7.verse: Earth, you will tremble, when the Lord God of Jacob comes near,

8.verse: because he turns solid rock into flowing streams and pools of water.

1.verse: The LORD Deserves To Be Praised - We don’t deserve praise! The LORD alone deserves all of the praise, because of his love and faithfulness.

2.verse: Why should the nations ask, “Where is your God?”

3.verse: Our God is in the heavens, doing as he chooses.

4.verse: The idols of the nations are made of silver and gold.

5.verse: They have a mouth and eyes, but they can’t speak or see.

6.verse: Their ears can’t hear, and their noses can’t smell.

7.verse: Their hands have no feeling, their legs don’t move, and they can’t make a sound.

8.verse: Everyone who made the idols and all who trust them are just as helpless as those useless gods.

9.verse: People of Israel, you must trust the LORD to help and protect you.

10.verse: Family of Aaron the priest, you must trust the LORD to help and protect you.

11.verse: All of you worship the LORD, so you must trust him to help and protect you.

12.verse: The LORD will not forget to give us his blessing; he will bless all of Israel and the family of Aaron.

13.verse: All who worship the LORD, no matter who they are, will receive his blessing.

14.verse: I pray that the LORD will let your family and your descendants always grow strong.

15.verse: May the LORD who created the heavens and the earth give you his blessing.

16.verse: The LORD has kept the heavens for himself, but he has given the earth to us humans.

17.verse: The dead are silent and cannot praise the LORD,

18.verse: but we will praise him now and forevermore. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: When the LORD Saves You from Death - I love you, LORD! You answered my prayers.

2.verse: You paid attention to me, and so I will pray to you as long as I live.

3.verse: Death attacked from all sides, and I was captured by its painful chains. But when I was really hurting,

4.verse: I prayed and said, “LORD, please don’t let me die!”

5.verse: You are kind, LORD, so good and merciful.

6.verse: You protect ordinary people, and when I was helpless, you saved me

7.verse: and treated me so kindly that I don’t need to worry anymore.

8.verse: You, LORD, have saved my life from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.

9.verse: Now I will walk at your side in this land of the living.

10.verse: I was faithful to you when I was suffering,

11.verse: though in my confusion I said, “I can’t trust anyone!”

12.verse: What must I give you, LORD, for being so good to me?

13.verse: I will pour out an offering of wine to you, and I will pray in your name because you have saved me.

14.verse: I will keep my promise to you when your people meet.

15.verse: You are deeply concerned when one of your loyal people faces death.

16.verse: I worship you, LORD, just as my mother did, and you have rescued me from the chains of death.

17.verse: I will offer you a sacrifice to show how grateful I am, and I will pray.

18.verse: I will keep my promise to you when your people

19.verse: gather at your temple in Jerusalem. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: Come Praise the LORD - All of you nations, come praise the LORD! Let everyone praise him.

2.verse: His love for us is wonderful; his faithfulness never ends. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: The LORD Is Always Merciful - Tell the LORD how thankful you are, because he is kind and always merciful.

2.verse: Let Israel shout, “God is always merciful!”

3.verse: Let the family of Aaron the priest shout, “God is always merciful!”

4.verse: Let every true worshiper of the LORD shout, “God is always merciful!”

5.verse: When I was really hurting, I prayed to the LORD. He answered my prayer, and took my worries away.

6.verse: The LORD is on my side, and I am not afraid of what others can do to me.

7.verse: With the LORD on my side, I will defeat all of my hateful enemies.

8.verse: It is better to trust the LORD for protection than to trust anyone else,

9.verse: including strong leaders.

10.verse: Nations surrounded me, but I got rid of them by the power of the LORD.

11.verse: They attacked from all sides, but I got rid of them by the power of the LORD.

12.verse: They swarmed around like bees, but by the power of the LORD, I got rid of them and their fiery sting.

13.verse: Their attacks were so fierce that I nearly fell, but the LORD helped me.

14.verse: My power and my strength come from the LORD, and he has saved me.

15.verse: From the tents of God’s people come shouts of victory: “The LORD is powerful!

16.verse: With his mighty arm the LORD wins victories! The LORD is powerful!”

17.verse: And so my life is safe, and I will live to tell what the LORD has done.

18.verse: He punished me terribly, but he did not let death lay its hands on me.

19.verse: Open the gates of justice! I will enter and tell the LORD how thankful I am.

20.verse: Here is the gate of the LORD! Everyone who does right may enter this gate.

21.verse: I praise the LORD for answering my prayers and saving me.

22.verse: The stone that the builders tossed aside has now become the most important stone.

23.verse: The LORD has done this, and it is amazing to us.

24.verse: This day belongs to the LORD! Let’s celebrate and be glad today.

25.verse: We’ll ask the LORD to save us! We’ll sincerely ask the LORD to let us win.

26.verse: God bless the one who comes in the name of the LORD! We praise you from here in the house of the LORD.

27.verse: The LORD is our God, and he has given us light! Start the celebration! March with palm branches all the way to the altar.

28.verse: The LORD is my God! I will praise him and tell him how thankful I am.

29.verse: Tell the LORD how thankful you are, because he is kind and always merciful.

1.verse: In Praise of the Law of the LORD - Our LORD, you bless everyone who lives right and obeys your Law.

2.verse: You bless all of those who follow your commands from deep in their hearts

3.verse: and who never do wrong or turn from you.

4.verse: You have ordered us always to obey your teachings;

5.verse: I don’t ever want to stray from your laws.

6.verse: Thinking about your commands will keep me from doing some foolish thing.

7.verse: I will do right and praise you by learning to respect your perfect laws.

8.verse: I will obey all of them! Don’t turn your back on me.

9.verse: Young people can live a clean life by obeying your word.

10.verse: I worship you with all my heart. Don’t let me walk away from your commands.

11.verse: I treasure your word above all else; it keeps me from sinning against you.

12.verse: I praise you, LORD! Teach me your laws.

13.verse: With my own mouth, I tell others the laws that you have spoken.

14.verse: Obeying your instructions brings as much happiness as being rich.

15.verse: I will study your teachings and follow your footsteps.

16.verse: I will take pleasure in your laws and remember your words.

17.verse: Treat me with kindness, LORD, so that I may live and do what you say.

18.verse: Open my mind and let me discover the wonders of your Law.

19.verse: I live here as a stranger. Don’t keep me from knowing your commands.

20.verse: What I want most of all and at all times is to honor your laws.

21.verse: You punish those boastful, worthless nobodies who turn from your commands.

22.verse: Don’t let them sneer and insult me for following you.

23.verse: I keep thinking about your teachings, LORD, even if rulers plot against me.

24.verse: Your laws are my greatest joy! I follow their advice.

25.verse: I am at the point of death. Let your teachings breathe new life into me.

26.verse: When I told you my troubles, you answered my prayers. Now teach me your laws.

27.verse: Help me to understand your teachings, and I will think about your marvelous deeds.

28.verse: I am overcome with sorrow. Encourage me, as you have promised to do.

29.verse: Keep me from being deceitful, and be kind enough to teach me your Law.

30.verse: I am determined to be faithful and to respect your laws.

31.verse: I follow your rules, LORD. Don’t let me be ashamed.

32.verse: I am eager to learn all that you want me to do; help me to understand more and more.

33.verse: Point out your rules to me, and I won’t disobey even one of them.

34.verse: Help me to understand your Law; I promise to obey it with all my heart.

35.verse: Direct me by your commands! I love to do what you say.

36.verse: Make me want to obey you, rather than to be rich.

37.verse: Take away my foolish desires, and let me find life by walking with you.

38.verse: I am your servant! Do for me what you promised to those who worship you.

39.verse: Your wonderful teachings protect me from the insults that I hate so much.

40.verse: I long for your teachings. Be true to yourself and let me live.

41.verse: Show me your love and save me, LORD, as you have promised.

42.verse: Then I will have an answer for everyone who insults me for trusting your word.

43.verse: I rely on your laws! Don’t take away my chance to speak your truth.

44.verse: I will keep obeying your Law forever and ever.

45.verse: I have gained perfect freedom by following your teachings,

46.verse: and I trust them so much that I tell them to kings.

47.verse: I love your commands! They bring me happiness.

48.verse: I love and respect them and will keep them in mind.

49.verse: Don’t forget your promise to me, your servant. I depend on it.

50.verse: When I am hurting, I find comfort in your promise that leads to life.

51.verse: Conceited people sneer at me, but I obey your Law.

52.verse: I find true comfort, LORD, because your laws have stood the test of time.

53.verse: I get furious when evil people turn against your Law.

54.verse: No matter where I am, your teachings fill me with songs.

55.verse: Even in the night I think about you, LORD, and I obey your Law.

56.verse: You have blessed me because I have always followed your teachings.

57.verse: You, LORD, are my choice, and I will obey you.

58.verse: With all my heart I beg you to be kind to me, just as you have promised.

59.verse: I pay careful attention as you lead me, and I follow closely.

60.verse: As soon as you command, I do what you say.

61.verse: Evil people may set a trap, but I obey your Law.

62.verse: Your laws are so fair that I wake up and praise you in the middle of the night.

63.verse: I choose as my friends everyone who worships you and follows your teachings.

64.verse: Our LORD, your love is seen all over the world. Teach me your laws.

65.verse: I am your servant, LORD, and you have kept your promise to treat me with kindness.

66.verse: Give me wisdom and good sense. I trust your commands.

67.verse: Once you corrected me for not obeying you, but now I obey.

68.verse: You are kindhearted, and you do good things, so teach me your laws.

69.verse: My reputation is being ruined by conceited liars, but with all my heart I follow your teachings.

70.verse: Those liars have no sense, but I find happiness in your Law.

71.verse: When you corrected me, it did me good because it taught me to study your laws.

72.verse: I would rather obey you than to have a thousand pieces of silver and gold.

73.verse: You created me and put me together. Make me wise enough to learn what you have commanded.

74.verse: Your worshipers will see me, and they will be glad that I trust your word.

75.verse: Your decisions are correct, and you were right to punish me.

76.verse: I serve you, LORD. Comfort me with your love, just as you have promised.

77.verse: I love to obey your Law! Have mercy and let me live.

78.verse: Put down those proud people who hurt me with their lies, because I have chosen to study your teachings.

79.verse: Let your worshipers come to me, so they will learn to obey your rules.

80.verse: Let me truly respect your laws, so I won’t be ashamed.

81.verse: I long for you to rescue me! Your word is my only hope.

82.verse: I am worn out from waiting for you to keep your word. When will you have mercy?

83.verse: My life is wasting away like a dried-up wineskin, but I have not forgotten your teachings.

84.verse: I am your servant! How long must I suffer? When will you punish those troublemakers?

85.verse: Those proud people reject your teachings, and they dig pits for me to fall in.

86.verse: Your laws can be trusted! Protect me from cruel liars.

87.verse: They have almost killed me, but I have been faithful to your teachings.

88.verse: Show that you love me and let me live, so that I may obey all of your commands.

89.verse: Our LORD, you are eternal! Your word will last as long as the heavens.

90.verse: You remain faithful in every generation, and the earth you created will keep standing firm.

91.verse: All things are your servants, and the laws you made are still in effect today.

92.verse: If I had not found happiness in obeying your Law, I would have died in misery.

93.verse: I won’t ever forget your teachings, because you give me new life by following them.

94.verse: I belong to you, and I have respected your laws, so keep me safe.

95.verse: Brutal enemies are waiting to ambush and destroy me, but I obey your rules.

96.verse: Nothing is completely perfect, except your teachings.

97.verse: I deeply love your Law! I think about it all day.

98.verse: Your laws never leave my mind, and they make me much wiser than my enemies.

99.verse: Thinking about your teachings gives me better understanding than my teachers,

100.verse: and obeying your laws makes me wiser than those who have lived a long time.

101.verse: I obey your word instead of following a way that leads to trouble.

102.verse: You have been my teacher, and I won’t reject your instructions.

103.verse: Your teachings are sweeter than honey.

104.verse: They give me understanding and make me hate all lies.

105.verse: Your word is a lamp that gives light wherever I walk.

106.verse: Your laws are fair, and I have given my word to respect them all.

107.verse: I am in terrible pain! Save me, LORD, as you said you would.

108.verse: Accept my offerings of praise and teach me your laws.

109.verse: I never forget your teachings, although my life is always in danger.

110.verse: Some merciless people are trying to trap me, but I never turn my back on your teachings.

111.verse: They will always be my most prized possession and my source of joy.

112.verse: I have made up my mind to obey your laws forever, no matter what.

113.verse: I hate anyone whose loyalty is divided, but I love your Law.

114.verse: You are my place of safety and my shield. Your word is my only hope.

115.verse: All of you worthless people, get away from me! I am determined to obey the commands of my God.

116.verse: Be true to your word, LORD. Keep me alive and strong; don’t let me be ashamed because of my hope.

117.verse: Keep me safe and secure, so that I will always respect your laws.

118.verse: You reject all deceitful liars because they refuse your teachings.

119.verse: As far as you are concerned, all evil people are garbage, and so I follow your rules.

120.verse: I tremble all over when I think of you and the way you judge.

121.verse: I did what was fair and right! Don’t hand me over to those who want to mistreat me.

122.verse: Take good care of me, your servant, and don’t let me be harmed by those conceited people.

123.verse: My eyes are weary from waiting to see you keep your promise to come and save me.

124.verse: Show your love for me, your servant, and teach me your laws.

125.verse: I serve you, so let me understand your teachings.

126.verse: Do something, LORD! They have broken your Law.

127.verse: Your laws mean more to me than the finest gold.

128.verse: I follow all of your commands, but I hate anyone who leads me astray.

129.verse: Your teachings are wonderful, and I respect them all.

130.verse: Understanding your word brings light to the minds of ordinary people.

131.verse: I honestly want to know everything you teach.

132.verse: Think about me and be kind, just as you are to everyone who loves your name.

133.verse: Keep your promise and don’t let me stumble or let sin control my life.

134.verse: Protect me from abuse, so I can obey your laws.

135.verse: Smile on me, your servant, and teach me your laws.

136.verse: When anyone disobeys you, my eyes overflow with tears.

137.verse: Our LORD, you always do right, and your decisions are fair.

138.verse: All of your teachings are true and trustworthy.

139.verse: It upsets me greatly when my enemies neglect your teachings.

140.verse: Your word to me, your servant, is like pure gold; I treasure what you say.

141.verse: Everyone calls me a nobody, but I remember your laws.

142.verse: You will always do right, and your teachings are true.

143.verse: I am in deep distress, but I love your teachings.

144.verse: Your rules are always fair. Help me to understand them and live.

145.verse: I pray to you, LORD! Please answer me. I promise to obey your laws.

146.verse: I beg you to save me, so I can follow your rules.

147.verse: Even before sunrise, I pray for your help, and I put my hope in what you have said.

148.verse: I lie awake at night, thinking of your promises.

149.verse: Show that you love me, LORD, and answer my prayer. Please do the right thing and save my life.

150.verse: People who disobey your Law have made evil plans and want to hurt me,

151.verse: but you are with me, and all of your commands can be trusted.

152.verse: From studying your laws, I found out long ago that you made them to last forever.

153.verse: I have not forgotten your Law! Look at the trouble I am in, and rescue me.

154.verse: Be my defender and protector! Keep your promise and save my life.

155.verse: Evil people won’t obey you, and so they have no hope of being saved.

156.verse: You are merciful, LORD! Please do the right thing and save my life.

157.verse: I have a lot of brutal enemies, but still I never turn from your laws.

158.verse: All of those unfaithful people who refuse to obey you are disgusting to me.

159.verse: Remember how I love your laws, and show your love for me by keeping me safe.

160.verse: All you say can be trusted; your teachings are true and will last forever.

161.verse: Rulers are cruel to me for no reason. But with all my heart I respect your words,

162.verse: because they bring happiness like treasures taken in war.

163.verse: I can’t stand liars, but I love your Law.

164.verse: I praise you seven times a day because your laws are fair.

165.verse: You give peace of mind to all who love your Law. Nothing can make them fall.

166.verse: You are my only hope for being saved, LORD, and I do all you command.

167.verse: I love and obey your laws with all my heart.

168.verse: You know everything I do. You know I respect every law you have given.

169.verse: Please, LORD, hear my prayer and give me the understanding that comes from your word.

170.verse: Listen to my concerns and keep me safe, just as you have promised.

171.verse: If you will teach me your laws, I will praise you

172.verse: and sing about your promise, because all of your teachings are what they ought to be.

173.verse: Be ready to protect me because I have chosen to obey your laws.

174.verse: I am waiting for you to save me, LORD. Your Law makes me happy.

175.verse: Keep me alive, so I can praise you, and let me find help in your teachings.

176.verse: I am your servant, but I have wandered away like a lost sheep. Please come after me, because I have not forgotten your teachings.

1.verse: (A song for worship.)A Prayer for the LORD’s Help - When I am in trouble, I pray,

2.verse: “Come and save me, LORD, from deceitful liars!”

3.verse: What punishment is fitting for you deceitful liars?

4.verse: Your reward should be sharp and flaming arrows!

5.verse: But I must live as a foreigner among the people of Meshech and in the tents of Kedar.

6.verse: I have spent too much time living among people who hate peace.

7.verse: I am in favor of peace, but when I speak of it, all they want is war.

1.verse: (A song for worship.)The LORD Will Protect His People - I look to the hills! Where will I find help?

2.verse: It will come from the LORD, who created the heavens and the earth.

3.verse: The LORD is your protector, and he won’t go to sleep or let you stumble.

4.verse: The protector of Israel doesn’t doze or ever get drowsy.

5.verse: The LORD is your protector, there at your right side to shade you from the sun.

6.verse: You won’t be harmed by the sun during the day or by the moon at night.

7.verse: The LORD will protect you and keep you safe from all dangers.

8.verse: The LORD will protect you now and always wherever you go.

1.verse: (A song by David for worship.)A Song of Praise - It made me glad to hear them say, “Let’s go to the house of the LORD!”

2.verse: Jerusalem, we are standing inside your gates.

3.verse: Jerusalem, what a strong and beautiful city you are!

4.verse: Every tribe of the LORD obeys him and comes to you to praise his name.

5.verse: David’s royal throne is here where justice rules.

6.verse: Jerusalem, we pray that you will have peace, and that all will go well for those who love you.

7.verse: May there be peace inside your city walls and in your palaces.

8.verse: Because of my friends and my relatives, I will pray for peace.

9.verse: And because of the house of the LORD our God, I will work for your good.

1.verse: (A song for worship.)A Prayer for Mercy - Our LORD and our God, I turn my eyes to you, on your throne in heaven.

2.verse: Servants look to their master, but we will look to you, until you have mercy on us.

3.verse: Please have mercy, LORD! We have been insulted more than we can stand,

4.verse: and we can’t take more abuse from those proud, conceited people.

1.verse: (A song by David for worship.)Thanking the LORD for Victory - The LORD was on our side! Let everyone in Israel say:

2.verse: “The LORD was on our side! Otherwise, the enemy attack

3.verse: would have killed us all, because it was furious.

4.verse: We would have been swept away in a violent flood

5.verse: of high and roaring waves.”

6.verse: Let’s praise the LORD! He protected us from enemies who were like wild animals,

7.verse: and we escaped like birds from a hunter’s torn net.

8.verse: The LORD made heaven and earth, and he is the one who sends us help.

1.verse: (A song for worship.)The LORD’s People Are Safe - Everyone who trusts the LORD is like Mount Zion that cannot be shaken and will stand forever.

2.verse: Just as Jerusalem is protected by mountains on every side, the LORD protects his people by holding them in his arms now and forever.

3.verse: He won’t let the wicked rule his people or lead them to do wrong.

4.verse: Let’s ask the LORD to be kind to everyone who is good and completely obeys him.

5.verse: When the LORD punishes the wicked, he will punish everyone else who lives a crooked life. Pray for peace in Israel!

1.verse: (A song for worship.)Celebrating the Harvest - It seemed like a dream when the LORD brought us back to the city of Zion.

2.verse: We celebrated with laughter and joyful songs. In foreign nations it was said, “The LORD has worked miracles for his people.”

3.verse: And so we celebrated because the LORD had indeed worked miracles for us.

4.verse: Our LORD, we ask you to bless our people again, and let us be like streams in the Southern Desert.

5.verse: We cried as we went out to plant our seeds. Now let us celebrate as we bring in the crops.

6.verse: We cried on the way to plant our seeds, but we will celebrate and shout as we bring in the crops.

1.verse: (A song by Solomon for worship.)Only the LORD Can Bless a Home - Without the help of the LORD it is useless to build a home or to guard a city.

2.verse: It is useless to get up early and stay up late in order to earn a living. God takes care of his own, even while they sleep.

3.verse: Children are a blessing and a gift from the LORD.

4.verse: Having a lot of children to take care of you in your old age is like a warrior with a lot of arrows.

5.verse: The more you have, the better off you will be, because they will protect you when your enemies attack with arguments.

1.verse: (A song for worship.)The LORD Rewards His Faithful People - The LORD will bless you if you respect him and obey his laws.

2.verse: Your fields will produce, and you will be happy and all will go well.

3.verse: Your wife will be as fruitful as a grapevine, and just as an olive tree is rich with olives, your home will be rich with healthy children.

4.verse: That is how the LORD will bless everyone who respects him.

5.verse: I pray that the LORD will bless you from Zion and let Jerusalem prosper as long as you live.

6.verse: May you live long enough to see your grandchildren. Let’s pray for peace in Israel!

1.verse: (A song for worship.)A Prayer for Protection - Since the time I was young, enemies have often attacked! Let everyone in Israel say:

2.verse: “Since the time I was young, enemies have often attacked! But they have not defeated me,

3.verse: though my back is like a field that has just been plowed.”

4.verse: The LORD always does right, and he has set me free from the ropes of those cruel people.

5.verse: I pray that all who hate the city of Zion will be made ashamed and forced to turn and run.

6.verse: May they be like grass on the flat roof of a house, grass that dries up as soon as it sprouts.

7.verse: Don’t let them be like wheat gathered in bundles.

8.verse: And don’t let anyone who passes by say to them, “The LORD bless you! I give you my blessing in the name of the LORD.”

1.verse: (A song for worship.)Trusting the LORD in Times of Trouble - From a sea of troubles I call out to you, LORD.

2.verse: Won’t you please listen as I beg for mercy?

3.verse: If you kept record of our sins, no one could last long.

4.verse: But you forgive us, and so we will worship you.

5.verse: With all my heart, I am waiting, LORD, for you! I trust your promises.

6.verse: I wait for you more eagerly than a soldier on guard duty waits for the dawn. Yes, I wait more eagerly than a soldier on guard duty waits for the dawn.

7.verse: Israel, trust the LORD! He is always merciful, and he has the power to save you.

8.verse: Israel, the LORD will save you from all of your sins.

1.verse: (A song by David for worship.)Trust the LORD! - I am not conceited, LORD, and I don’t waste my time on impossible schemes.

2.verse: But I have learned to feel safe and satisfied, just like a young child on its mother’s lap.

3.verse: People of Israel, you must trust the LORD now and forever.

1.verse: (A song for worship.)The LORD Is Always with His People - Our LORD, don’t forget David and how he suffered.

2.verse: Mighty God of Jacob, remember how he promised:

3.verse: “I won’t go home or crawl into bed

4.verse: or close my eyelids,

5.verse: until I find a home for you, the mighty LORD God of Jacob.”

6.verse: When we were in Ephrath, we heard that the sacred chest was somewhere near Jaar.

7.verse: Then we said, “Let’s go to the throne of the LORD and worship at his feet.”

8.verse: Come to your new home, LORD, you and the sacred chest with all of its power.

9.verse: Let victory be like robes for the priests; let your faithful people celebrate and shout.

10.verse: David is your chosen one, so don’t reject him.

11.verse: You made a solemn promise to David, when you said, “I, the LORD, promise that someone in your family will always be king.

12.verse: If they keep our agreement and follow my teachings, then someone in your family will rule forever.”

13.verse: You have gladly chosen Zion as your home, our LORD.

14.verse: You said, “This is my home! I will live here forever.

15.verse: I will bless Zion with food, and even the poor will eat until they are full.

16.verse: Victory will be like robes for the priests, and its faithful people will celebrate and shout.

17.verse: I will give mighty power to the kingdom of David. Each one of my chosen kings will shine like a lamp

18.verse: and wear a sparkling crown. But I will disgrace their enemies.”

1.verse: (A song for worship.)Living Together in Peace - It is truly wonderful when relatives live together in peace.

2.verse: It is as beautiful as olive oil poured on Aaron’s head and running down his beard and the collar of his robe.

3.verse: It is like the dew from Mount Hermon, falling on Zion’s mountains, where the LORD has promised to bless his people with life forevermore.

1.verse: (A song for worship.)Praising the LORD at Night - Everyone who serves the LORD, come and offer praises. Everyone who has gathered in his temple tonight,

2.verse: lift your hands in prayer toward his holy place and praise the LORD.

3.verse: The LORD is the Creator of heaven and earth, and I pray that the LORD will bless you from Zion.

1.verse: In Praise of the LORD’s Kindness - Shout praises to the LORD! You are his servants, so praise his name.

2.verse: All who serve in the temple of the LORD our God,

3.verse: come and shout praises. Praise the name of the LORD! He is kind and good.

4.verse: He chose the family of Jacob and the people of Israel for his very own.

5.verse: The LORD is much greater than any other god.

6.verse: He does as he chooses in heaven and on earth and deep in the sea.

7.verse: The LORD makes the clouds rise from far across the earth, and he makes lightning to go with the rain. Then from his secret place he sends out the wind.

8.verse: The LORD killed the first-born of people and animals in the land of Egypt.

9.verse: God used miracles and wonders to fight the king of Egypt and all of his officials.

10.verse: He destroyed many nations and killed powerful kings,

11.verse: including King Sihon of the Amorites and King Og of Bashan. He conquered every kingdom in the land of Canaan

12.verse: and gave their property to his people Israel.

13.verse: The name of the LORD will be remembered forever, and he will be famous for all time to come.

14.verse: The LORD will bring justice and show mercy to all who serve him.

15.verse: Idols of silver and gold are made and worshiped in other nations.

16.verse: They have a mouth and eyes, but they can’t speak or see.

17.verse: They are completely deaf, and they can’t breathe.

18.verse: Everyone who makes idols and all who trust them will end up as helpless as their idols.

19.verse: Everyone in Israel, come praise the LORD! All the family of Aaron

20.verse: and all the tribe of Levi, come praise the LORD! All of his worshipers, come praise the LORD.

21.verse: Praise the LORD from Zion! He lives here in Jerusalem. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: God’s Love Never Fails - Praise the LORD! He is good. God’s love never fails.

2.verse: Praise the God of all gods. God’s love never fails.

3.verse: Praise the Lord of lords. God’s love never fails.

4.verse: Only God works great miracles. God’s love never fails.

5.verse: With wisdom he made the sky. God’s love never fails.

6.verse: The Lord stretched the earth over the ocean. God’s love never fails.

7.verse: He made the bright lights in the sky. God’s love never fails.

8.verse: He lets the sun rule each day. God’s love never fails.

9.verse: He lets the moon and the stars rule each night. God’s love never fails.

10.verse: God struck down the first-born in every Egyptian family. God’s love never fails.

11.verse: He rescued Israel from Egypt. God’s love never fails.

12.verse: God used his great strength and his powerful arm. God’s love never fails.

13.verse: He split the Red Sea apart. God’s love never fails.

14.verse: The Lord brought Israel safely through the sea. God’s love never fails.

15.verse: He destroyed the Egyptian king and his army there. God’s love never fails.

16.verse: The Lord led his people through the desert. God’s love never fails.

17.verse: Our God defeated mighty kings. God’s love never fails.

18.verse: And he killed famous kings. God’s love never fails.

19.verse: One of them was Sihon, king of the Amorites. God’s love never fails.

20.verse: Another was King Og of Bashan. God’s love never fails.

21.verse: God took away their land. God’s love never fails.

22.verse: He gave their land to Israel, the people who serve him. God’s love never fails.

23.verse: God saw the trouble we were in. God’s love never fails.

24.verse: He rescued us from our enemies. God’s love never fails.

25.verse: He gives food to all who live. God’s love never fails.

26.verse: Praise God in heaven! God’s love never fails.

1.verse: A Prayer for Revenge - Beside the rivers of Babylon we thought about Jerusalem, and we sat down and cried.

2.verse: We hung our small harps on the willow trees.

3.verse: Our enemies had brought us here as their prisoners, and now they wanted us to sing and entertain them. They insulted us and shouted, “Sing about Zion!”

4.verse: Here in a foreign land, how can we sing about the LORD?

5.verse: Jerusalem, if I forget you, let my right hand go limp.

6.verse: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth, if I don’t think about you above all else.

7.verse: Our LORD, punish the Edomites! Because the day Jerusalem fell, they shouted, “Completely destroy the city! Tear down every building!”

8.verse: Babylon, you are doomed! I pray the Lord’s blessings on anyone who punishes you for what you did to us.

9.verse: May the Lord bless everyone who beats your children against the rocks!

1.verse: (By David.)Praise the LORD with All Your Heart - With all my heart I praise you, LORD. In the presence of angels I sing your praises.

2.verse: I worship at your holy temple and praise you for your love and your faithfulness. You were true to your word and made yourself more famous than ever before.

3.verse: When I asked for your help, you answered my prayer and gave me courage.

4.verse: All kings on this earth have heard your promises, LORD, and they will praise you.

5.verse: You are so famous that they will sing about the things you have done.

6.verse: Though you are above us all, you care for humble people, and you keep a close watch on everyone who is proud.

7.verse: I am surrounded by trouble, but you protect me against my angry enemies. With your own powerful arm you keep me safe.

8.verse: You, LORD, will always treat me with kindness. Your love never fails. You have made us what we are. Don’t give up on us now!

1.verse: (A psalm by David for the music leader.)The LORD Is Always Near - You have looked deep into my heart, LORD, and you know all about me.

2.verse: You know when I am resting or when I am working, and from heaven you discover my thoughts.

3.verse: You notice everything I do and everywhere I go.

4.verse: Before I even speak a word, you know what I will say,

5.verse: and with your powerful arm you protect me from every side.

6.verse: I can’t understand all of this! Such wonderful knowledge is far above me.

7.verse: Where could I go to escape from your Spirit or from your sight?

8.verse: If I were to climb up to the highest heavens, you would be there. If I were to dig down to the world of the dead you would also be there.

9.verse: Suppose I had wings like the dawning day and flew across the ocean.

10.verse: Even then your powerful arm would guide and protect me.

11.verse: Or suppose I said, “I’ll hide in the dark until night comes to cover me over.”

12.verse: But you see in the dark because daylight and dark are all the same to you.

13.verse: You are the one who put me together inside my mother’s body,

14.verse: and I praise you because of the wonderful way you created me. Everything you do is marvelous! Of this I have no doubt.

15.verse: Nothing about me is hidden from you! I was secretly woven together deep in the earth below,

16.verse: but with your own eyes you saw my body being formed. Even before I was born, you had written in your book everything I would do.

17.verse: Your thoughts are far beyond my understanding, much more than I could ever imagine.

18.verse: I try to count your thoughts, but they outnumber the grains of sand on the beach. And when I awake, I will find you nearby.

19.verse: How I wish that you would kill all cruel and heartless people and protect me from them!

20.verse: They are always rebelling and speaking evil of you.

21.verse: You know I hate anyone who hates you, LORD, and refuses to obey.

22.verse: They are my enemies too, and I truly hate them.

23.verse: Look deep into my heart, God, and find out everything I am thinking.

24.verse: Don’t let me follow evil ways, but lead me in the way that time has proven true.

1.verse: (A psalm by David for the music leader.)A Prayer for the LORD’s Help - Rescue me from cruel and violent enemies, LORD!

2.verse: They think up evil plans and always cause trouble.

3.verse: Their words bite deep like the poisonous fangs of a snake.

4.verse: Protect me, LORD, from cruel and brutal enemies, who want to destroy me.

5.verse: Those proud people have hidden traps and nets to catch me as I walk.

6.verse: You, LORD, are my God! Please listen to my prayer.

7.verse: You have the power to save me, and you keep me safe in every battle.

8.verse: Don’t let the wicked succeed in doing what they want, or else they might never stop planning evil.

9.verse: They have me surrounded, but make them the victims of their own vicious lies.

10.verse: Dump flaming coals on them and throw them into pits where they can’t climb out.

11.verse: Chase those cruel liars away! Let trouble hunt them down.

12.verse: Our LORD, I know that you defend the homeless and see that the poor are given justice.

13.verse: Your people will praise you and will live with you because they do right.

1.verse: (A psalm by David.)A Prayer for the LORD’s Protection - I pray to you, LORD! Please listen when I pray and hurry to help me.

2.verse: Think of my prayer as sweet-smelling incense, and think of my lifted hands as an evening sacrifice.

3.verse: Help me to guard my words whenever I say something.

4.verse: Don’t let me want to do evil or waste my time doing wrong with wicked people. Don’t let me even taste the good things they offer.

5.verse: Let your faithful people correct and punish me. My prayers condemn the deeds of those who do wrong, so don’t let me be friends with any of them.

6.verse: Everyone will admit that I was right when their rulers are thrown down a rocky cliff,

7.verse: and their bones lie scattered like broken rocks on top of a grave.

8.verse: You are my LORD and God, and I look to you for safety. Don’t let me be harmed.

9.verse: Protect me from the traps of those violent people,

10.verse: and make them fall into their own traps while you help me escape.

1.verse: (A special psalm and a prayer by David when he was in the cave.)A Prayer for Help - I pray to you, LORD. I beg for mercy.

2.verse: I tell you all of my worries and my troubles,

3.verse: and whenever I feel low, you are there to guide me. A trap has been hidden along my pathway.

4.verse: Even if you look, you won’t see anyone who cares enough to walk beside me. There is no place to hide, and no one who really cares.

5.verse: I pray to you, LORD! You are my place of safety, and you are my choice in the land of the living. Please answer my prayer. I am completely helpless.

6.verse: Help! They are chasing me, and they are too strong.

7.verse: Rescue me from this prison, so I can praise your name. And when your people notice your wonderful kindness to me, they will rush to my side.

1.verse: (A psalm by David.)A Prayer in Time of Danger - Listen, LORD, as I pray! You are faithful and honest and will answer my prayer.

2.verse: I am your servant. Don’t try me in your court, because no one is innocent by your standards.

3.verse: My enemies are chasing me, crushing me in the ground. I am in total darkness, like someone long dead.

4.verse: I have given up all hope, and I feel numb all over.

5.verse: I remember to think about the many things you did in years gone by.

6.verse: Then I lift my hands in prayer, because my soul is a desert, thirsty for water from you.

7.verse: Please hurry, LORD, and answer my prayer. I feel hopeless. Don’t turn away and leave me here to die.

8.verse: Each morning let me learn more about your love because I trust you. I come to you in prayer, asking for your guidance.

9.verse: Please rescue me from my enemies, LORD! I come to you for safety.

10.verse: You are my God. Show me what you want me to do, and let your gentle Spirit lead me in the right path.

11.verse: Be true to your name, LORD, and keep my life safe. Use your saving power to protect me from trouble.

12.verse: I am your servant. Show how much you love me by destroying my enemies.

1.verse: (By David.)A Prayer for the Nation - I praise you, LORD! You are my mighty rock, and you teach me how to fight my battles.

2.verse: You are my friend, and you are my fortress where I am safe. You are my shield, and you made me the ruler of our people.

3.verse: Why do we humans mean anything to you, our LORD? Why do you care about us?

4.verse: We disappear like a breath; we last no longer than a faint shadow.

5.verse: Open the heavens like a curtain and come down, LORD. Touch the mountains and make them send up smoke.

6.verse: Use your lightning as arrows to scatter my enemies and make them run away.

7.verse: Reach down from heaven and set me free. Save me from the mighty flood

8.verse: of those lying foreigners who can’t tell the truth.

9.verse: In praise of you, our God, I will sing a new song, while playing my harp.

10.verse: By your power, kings win wars, and your servant David is saved from deadly swords.

11.verse: Won’t you keep me safe from those lying foreigners who can’t tell the truth?

12.verse: Let’s pray that our young sons will grow like strong plants and that our daughters will be as lovely as columns in the corner of a palace.

13.verse: May our barns be filled with all kinds of crops. May our fields be covered with sheep by the thousands,

14.verse: and every cow have calves. Don’t let our city be captured or any of us be taken away, and don’t let cries of sorrow be heard in our streets.

15.verse: Our LORD and our God, you give these blessings to all who worship you.

1.verse: (By David for praise.)The LORD Is Kind and Merciful - I will praise you, my God and King, and always honor your name.

2.verse: I will praise you each day and always honor your name.

3.verse: You are wonderful, LORD, and you deserve all praise, because you are much greater than anyone can understand.

4.verse: Each generation will announce to the next your wonderful and powerful deeds.

5.verse: I will keep thinking about your marvelous glory and your mighty miracles.

6.verse: Everyone will talk about your fearsome deeds, and I will tell all nations how great you are.

7.verse: They will celebrate and sing about your matchless mercy and your power to save.

8.verse: You are merciful, LORD! You are kind and patient and always loving.

9.verse: You are good to everyone, and you take care of all your creation.

10.verse: All creation will thank you, and your loyal people will praise you.

11.verse: They will tell about your marvelous kingdom and your power.

12.verse: Then everyone will know about the mighty things you do and your glorious kingdom.

13.verse: Your kingdom will never end, and you will rule forever. Our LORD, you keep your word and do everything you say.

14.verse: When someone stumbles or falls, you give a helping hand.

15.verse: Everyone depends on you, and when the time is right, you provide them with food.

16.verse: By your own hand you satisfy the desires of all who live.

17.verse: Our LORD, everything you do is kind and thoughtful,

18.verse: and you are near to everyone whose prayers are sincere.

19.verse: You satisfy the desires of all your worshipers, and you come to save them when they ask for help.

20.verse: You take care of everyone who loves you, but you destroy the wicked.

21.verse: I will praise you, LORD, and everyone will respect your holy name forever.

1.verse: Shout Praises to the LORD - Shout praises to the LORD! With all that I am, I will shout his praises.

2.verse: I will sing and praise the LORD God for as long as I live.

3.verse: You can’t depend on anyone, not even a great leader.

4.verse: Once they die and are buried, that will be the end of all their plans.

5.verse: The LORD God of Jacob blesses everyone who trusts him and depends on him.

6.verse: God made heaven and earth; he created the sea and everything else. God always keeps his word.

7.verse: He gives justice to the poor and food to the hungry. The LORD sets prisoners free

8.verse: and heals blind eyes. He gives a helping hand to everyone who falls. The LORD loves good people

9.verse: and looks after strangers. He defends the rights of orphans and widows, but destroys the wicked.

10.verse: The LORD God of Zion will rule forever! Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: Sing and Praise the LORD - Shout praises to the LORD! Our God is kind, and it is right and good to sing praises to him.

2.verse: The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem and brings the people of Israel back home again.

3.verse: He renews our hopes and heals our bodies.

4.verse: He decided how many stars there would be in the sky and gave each one a name.

5.verse: Our LORD is great and powerful! He understands everything.

6.verse: The LORD helps the poor, but he smears the wicked in the dirt.

7.verse: Celebrate and sing! Play your harps for the LORD our God.

8.verse: He fills the sky with clouds and sends rain to the earth, so that the hills will be green with grass.

9.verse: He provides food for cattle and for the young ravens, when they cry out.

10.verse: The LORD doesn’t care about the strength of horses or powerful armies.

11.verse: The LORD is pleased only with those who worship him and trust his love.

12.verse: Everyone in Jerusalem, come and praise the LORD your God!

13.verse: He makes your city gates strong and blesses your people by giving them children.

14.verse: God lets you live in peace, and he gives you the very best wheat.

15.verse: As soon as God speaks, the earth obeys.

16.verse: He covers the ground with snow like a blanket of wool, and he scatters frost like ashes on the ground.

17.verse: God sends down hailstones like chips of rocks. Who can stand the cold?

18.verse: At his command the ice melts, the wind blows, and streams begin to flow.

19.verse: God gave his laws and teachings to the descendants of Jacob, the nation of Israel.

20.verse: But he has not given his laws to any other nation. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: Come Praise the LORD - Shout praises to the LORD! Shout the LORD’s praises in the highest heavens.

2.verse: All of you angels, and all who serve him above, come and offer praise.

3.verse: Sun and moon, and all of you bright stars, come and offer praise.

4.verse: Highest heavens, and the water above the highest heavens, come and offer praise.

5.verse: Let all things praise the name of the LORD, because they were created at his command.

6.verse: He made them to last forever, and nothing can change what he has done.

7.verse: All creatures on earth, you obey his commands, so come praise the LORD!

8.verse: Sea monsters and the deep sea, fire and hail, snow and frost, and every stormy wind, come praise the LORD!

9.verse: All mountains and hills, fruit trees and cedars,

10.verse: every wild and tame animal, all reptiles and birds, come praise the LORD!

11.verse: Every king and every ruler, all nations on earth,

12.verse: every man and every woman, young people and old, come praise the LORD!

13.verse: All creation, come praise the name of the LORD. Praise his name alone. The glory of God is greater than heaven and earth.

14.verse: Like a bull with mighty horns, the LORD protects his faithful nation Israel, because they belong to him. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: A New Song of Praise - Shout praises to the LORD! Sing him a new song of praise when his loyal people meet.

2.verse: People of Israel, rejoice because of your Creator. People of Zion, celebrate because of your King.

3.verse: Praise his name by dancing and playing music on harps and tambourines.

4.verse: The LORD is pleased with his people, and he gives victory to those who are humble.

5.verse: All of you faithful people, praise our glorious Lord! Celebrate and worship.

6.verse: Praise God with songs on your lips and a sword in your hand.

7.verse: Take revenge and punish the nations.

8.verse: Put chains of iron on their kings and rulers.

9.verse: Punish them as they deserve; this is the privilege of God’s faithful people. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.verse: The LORD Is Good to His People - Shout praises to the LORD! Praise God in his temple. Praise him in heaven, his mighty fortress.

2.verse: Praise our God! His deeds are wonderful, too marvelous to describe.

3.verse: Praise God with trumpets and all kinds of harps.

4.verse: Praise him with tambourines and dancing, with stringed instruments and woodwinds.

5.verse: Praise God with cymbals, with clashing cymbals.

6.verse: Let every living creature praise the LORD. Shout praises to the LORD!
